titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 43: Sharḥ ashkāl al-taʼsīs.

msContents.summary: Qāḍīʹzādah's commentary on Samarqandī's Ashkāl al-taʼsīs, an explication of Euclid's 35 geometrical propositions. Source-text is written in red with commentary in black; numerous diagrams.

persName.#text: Samarqandī, Muḥammad ibn Ashraf, active 13th century

supportDesc.extent: 48 foliated leaves : 195 x 115 (145 x 70) mm, bound to 205 x 130 mm
supportDesc.foliation: In Eastern Hindu-Arabic numerals, upper middle recto. Catchwords on versos, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻliq; pointed, mostly unvocalized.

decoNote: Headings and source-text material in red, overlines in red; geometrical figures in red and black in the text and in the margins; overlines in black.

decoNote.#text: Diagram: right, acute, and obtuse angles
Diagram: center, diameter, radius of circle

binding.p: Red half leather binding with marbled paper sides. Sewn on recessed supports with hollow spine. Gold fillet lines and titling on spine.

origin.p: [circa 1100 AH?] (from note in pencil without specific reference to internal evidence on front flyleaf 2v).
